Structural.Name: Class Diagrams (UML)
Structural.Purpose: Visualizes the classes of a system and the relationships among them.
Structural.NotableCharacteristics: Emphasizes data structures and static designs.

Structural.Name: Component Diagrams (UML)
Structural.Purpose: Describes how a software system is split up into components and shows the dependencies among these components.

Structural.Name: Deployment Diagrams (UML)
Structural.Purpose: Models the physical deployment of artifacts on nodes.
Structural.NotableCharacteristics: Focuses on hardware and deployment specifics.

Structural.Name: Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD)
Structural.Purpose: Primarily used for data modeling to illustrate the database structure.
Structural.NotableCharacteristics: Commonly used in designing relational databases.

Structural.Name: SysML (Systems Modeling Language)
Structural.Purpose: A general-purpose modeling language for systems engineering.
Structural.NotableCharacteristics: Extends UML and provides additional diagrams like block definition diagrams.

Structural.Name: ArchiMate
Structural.NotableCharacteristics: Supports description of architectures through viewpoints and layers.

Behavioral.Name: Activity Diagrams (UML)
Behavioral.Purpose: Represents workflows of stepwise activities and actions.
Behavioral.NotableCharacteristics: Illustrates the flow from one activity to another.

Behavioral.Name: Sequence Diagrams (UML)
Behavioral.Purpose: Shows how objects communicate with each other in terms of a sequence of messages.
Behavioral.NotableCharacteristics: Useful for specifying interactions based on time sequence.

Behavioral.Name: State Machine Diagrams (UML)
Behavioral.Purpose: Describes the state transitions and actions of a system in response to events.

Behavioral.Name: Data Flow Diagrams (DFDs)
Behavioral.Purpose: Visualizes the flow of data through a system.
Behavioral.NotableCharacteristics: Emphasizes the movement of data between processes and data stores.

Behavioral.Name: Specification and Description Language (SDL)
Behavioral.Purpose: Used for specifying the behavior and structure of system applications.
Behavioral.NotableCharacteristics: Useful in telecommunications and real-time systems.

Behavioral.Name: Colored Petri Nets (CPNs)
Behavioral.Purpose: Models distributed systems with complex synchronizations.
Behavioral.NotableCharacteristics: Enhances the modeling capabilities of Petri nets by incorporating data and conditions.
